title: Sequences and Functions - ratio with initial

content.question: ​An exponential function <math alttext="G"><semantics><mi>G</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> has a known common ratio of <math alttext="1 half"><semantics><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and includes the input-output pair <math alttext="open parentheses 1 , 4 close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mn>1,4</mn></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following could define <math alttext="G open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>G</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="4 plus 1 half open parentheses x minus 1 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="1 half times 4 to the power of x"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="4 times open parentheses 1 half close parentheses to the power of x"><semantics><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mfenced><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mi>x</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="4 times open parentheses 1 half close parentheses to the power of open parentheses x minus 1 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mfenced><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="4 times open parentheses 1 half close parentheses to the power of open parentheses x minus 1 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mfenced><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 2.2: Change in Linear and Exponential Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
